title: C# Level 7 â€” Functions & Recursion
concept: Define and use functions with parameters and return values, including recursion.

challenges.title: Distance Between Two Points
challenges.description: Write a method double Distance(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) that returns the distance between points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). In Main, read four doubles, call the method and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: Four real numbers x1, y1, x2, y2.
challenges.outputDescription: One real number: distance between the two points.

challenges.title: Power Function (Iterative)
challenges.description: Write a method double Power(double a, int n) that returns a^n for integer n (n can be negative, zero, or positive). Use a loop inside the method. In Main, read a and n, call Power and print the result.

challenges.title: Capitalize Words
challenges.description: Write a method void Capitalize(ref string s) that makes the first letter of each word uppercase. Words are separated by single spaces. In Main, read a line into s, call Capitalize, then print s.
challenges.outputDescription: Same sentence with each word capitalized.
examples:
Input:
hello world from c#

Output:
Hello World From C#

challenges.title: Recursive Power (Non-Negative n)
challenges.description: Write a recursive method double PowerRec(double a, int n) to compute a^n for n >= 0. In Main, read a and n, call PowerRec, and print the result.

challenges.title: Recursive Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a method long Fib(int n) that returns the n-th Fibonacci number using recursion. Fib(0)=0, Fib(1)=1. Assume n <= 30. In Main, read n, print Fib(n).

challenges.title: Reverse Sequence Recursively
challenges.description: Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, print all numbers (except the final 0) in reverse order using recursion and without using arrays.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers, one per line, ending with 0.
challenges.outputDescription: Same numbers in reverse order, each on its own line.

challenges.title: Iterative Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a method long FibIter(int n) that computes the n-th Fibonacci number using a loop. In Main, read n and print FibIter(n).

challenges.title: Count Distinct (Function)
challenges.description: Write a method int CountDistinct(int[] a) that returns the number of distinct integers in the array. In Main, read n, then n integers into an array, call the method and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Max of Array (Function)
challenges.description: Write a method int MaxArray(int[] a) that returns the largest element. In Main, read n, the elements, and print the maximum.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.

challenges.title: Contains Element (Function)
challenges.description: Write a method bool Contains(int[] a, int x) that returns true if x appears in the array. In Main, read n, the elements, then x, and print YES if found, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers. Third line: x.
